quote: Another example is in prediction of drug-target interactions, for which machine learning is being used to narrow the search space for candidate drugs by application of predictive methods.
Implementation of machine learning techniques to -omics data is complex, however, when applied successfully they have been useful in obtaining meaningful biological insights.
The potential beneﬁts of applying machine learning methods to -omics data are becoming increasingly apparent, especially in clinical settings.
With the hope of this work enabling greater opportunity for implementing machine learning algorithms on -omics data produced in clinical and research settings.
We observed a signiﬁcant increase in performance while training on the combined data rather than each dataset independently.
We demonstrate this through prediction of short term survival in breast cancer patients, with the hope of greater monitoring and care for those patients at high risk.
Our deep learning pipeline enables the use of high dimensional -omics data from disparate sources to predict clinical outcomes.
This pipeline allows us to perform the following; model wrapping - handling custom models that respect a simple interface.
We believe this will be especially beneﬁcial in opening up -omics data to machine learning researchers.
Moreover, it allowed us to assess the relative importance of the features used in the prediction.
This method can be seen as a way to extend simple classiﬁers to high-dimensional data.
Tuning parameters where chosen using 10-fold cross validation.
